name: iRacing Setup Advisor
description: Connect handling issue nodes that match your car's behavior, then get AI-powered setup recommendations. Demonstrates: Selective node connection, issue aggregation, exclusive branch merge (waitForAll: false), LLM advice generation.

steps.title: Overview
steps.content:
An interactive advisor that helps sim racers fix handling issues using AI.

This workflow demonstrates several key patterns:

- **Selective Connection**: User manually connects only relevant issue nodes
- **Data Aggregation**: Merge node collects multiple inputs into a list
- **Conditional Routing**: IF node routes to different paths based on data
- **Exclusive Branch Merge**: Uses `waitForAll: false` for conditional branches
- **LLM Integration**: AI analyzes issues and provides expert advice

steps.title: The Trigger
steps.content:
Every workflow starts with a **trigger node**.

This workflow uses a **Manual Trigger** - the user clicks 'Run' to start the analysis.

| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| Type | `manualTrigger` |
| Purpose | User-initiated execution |
| Output | Empty object `{}` |

The trigger fires data to multiple nodes in parallel - the car info node and the connected issue nodes.

steps.title: Car & Track Context
steps.content:
The **Set** node stores static data that describes the racing context.

This data is always included in the analysis:

| Field | Example Value |
|-------|---------------|
| `car` | Porsche 911 GT3 R |
| `track` | Spa-Francorchamps |
| `conditions` | Dry, 25¬∞C track temp |
| `tireCompound` | Medium |
| `sessionType` | Race |

Edit these values to match YOUR setup before running!

steps.title: Issue Node Library
steps.content:
The column of **Set** nodes represents handling issues you might experience:

**üîµ Blue Nodes - Understeer Issues:**
- Slow Entry: Pushes wide at hairpins
- Fast Entry: Won't rotate at high speed
- Mid-Corner: Runs wide at apex

**üî¥ Red Nodes - Oversteer Issues:**
- Slow Entry: Rear snaps on turn-in
- Fast Entry: Rear nervous at speed
- Mid-Corner: Too much rotation
- Exit/Power: Wheel spin on throttle

**‚ö†Ô∏è Yellow Nodes - Special Issues:**
- Braking instability
- Low overall traction
- Curb/kerb instability

By default, most are **disconnected**. You drag connections to describe YOUR car's behavior!

steps.title: The Merge Collector
steps.content:
The **Merge** node in `append` mode collects all connected inputs into a list.

This is the key to the selective connection pattern:

| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| `mode` | `append` |
| Behavior | Waits for ALL inputs, combines into array |

If you connect 3 issue nodes + the car info, the merge outputs an array of 4 objects.

The more issues you connect, the more context the AI receives!

steps.title: Building the Prompt
steps.content:
The **Code** node processes the merged data and builds a structured prompt.

Key operations:
1. Separate car info from issues
2. Count the issues
3. Format a human-readable summary
4. Create context for the AI

This node uses **JavaScript** to transform data between nodes.

steps.title: Conditional Branching
steps.content:
The **IF** node routes execution based on a condition.

| Condition | Output Port |
|-----------|-------------|
| `issueCount > 0` | `true` ‚Üí AI Advisor |
| `issueCount == 0` | `false` ‚Üí No Issues message |

This creates **exclusive branches** - only ONE path will execute.

Expression syntax uses `{{ variable }}` to reference input data.

steps.title: The AI Advisor
steps.content:
The **LLM Chat** node sends data to an AI model (GPT-4 by default).

**System Prompt** defines the AI's role:
- Expert iRacing setup engineer
- Provides specific, actionable advice
- Structures response with DIAGNOSIS, SETUP CHANGES, TIPS, WARNINGS

**User Prompt** includes template variables:
- `{{ car }}` - The car being set up
- `{{ issuesSummary }}` - Formatted list of handling issues

Requires an OpenAI API key in Credentials Manager!

steps.title: Exclusive Branch Merge
steps.content:
The **Final Output** merge node uses a critical pattern for exclusive branches.

**The Problem:** Standard merge waits for ALL inputs. But with an IF node, only ONE branch fires - the other never sends data!

**The Solution:** Set `waitForAll: false` to proceed immediately when the first input arrives.

| Parameter | Value | Purpose |
|-----------|-------|----------|
| `mode` | `passthrough` | Pass data through unchanged |
| `waitForAll` | `false` | Don't wait for other branches |

steps.title: How To Use This Workflow
steps.content:
**Step 1: Configure Your Car**
Edit the 'Car & Track Info' node with your actual car, track, and conditions.

**Step 2: Connect Your Issues**
1. Look at the issue nodes (blue/red/yellow)
2. Find the ones matching your car's behavior
3. Drag connections from those nodes to 'Collect Issues'
4. Delete connections for issues you don't have

**Step 3: Add API Key**
Open Tools ‚Üí Credentials Manager and add your OpenAI API key.

**Step 4: Run!**
Click the Run button on the trigger node and get your personalized setup advice!

nodes.name: Analyze My Setup
nodes.notes: Click Run to start the setup analysis

nodes.name: Car & Track Info
nodes.notes: Configure your car, track, and current conditions here

nodes.name: üîµ Understeer: Slow Entry

values.description: Car pushes wide on turn-in at slow speed corners (hairpins, tight chicanes)
values.symptoms: Front tires scrubbing, need to reduce speed more than expected, missing apex

nodes.notes: CONNECT THIS if you have understeer entering slow corners (hairpins, chicanes)

nodes.name: üîµ Understeer: Fast Entry

values.description: Car doesn't want to rotate on initial turn-in at high speed corners
values.symptoms: Washing out at high speed entries, front feels light, car wants to go straight

nodes.notes: CONNECT THIS if you have understeer entering fast corners (sweepers, fast chicanes)

nodes.name: üîµ Understeer: Mid-Corner

values.description: Car pushes wide through the middle of corners while maintaining throttle
values.symptoms: Running wide at apex, having to wait longer before applying throttle

nodes.notes: CONNECT THIS if you have understeer through the middle of corners

nodes.name: üî¥ Oversteer: Slow Entry

values.description: Rear wants to come around on turn-in at slow corners under braking
values.symptoms: Snap oversteer on turn-in, rear stepping out under trail braking

nodes.notes: CONNECT THIS if you have oversteer entering slow corners

nodes.name: üî¥ Oversteer: Fast Entry

values.description: Rear becomes unstable at high speed corner entries
values.symptoms: Rear feels nervous, snappy rotation, need to catch slides on fast entries

nodes.notes: CONNECT THIS if you have oversteer entering fast corners

nodes.name: üî¥ Oversteer: Mid-Corner

values.description: Rear slides out through the middle of corners while coasting
values.symptoms: Car rotates too much mid-corner, need constant steering corrections

nodes.notes: CONNECT THIS if you have oversteer through the middle of corners

nodes.name: üî¥ Oversteer: Exit/Power

values.description: Rear breaks loose when applying throttle on corner exit
values.symptoms: Wheel spin, rear stepping out on power, tank slappers on exit

nodes.notes: CONNECT THIS if you have oversteer on corner exit when applying power

nodes.name: ‚ö†Ô∏è Unstable Under Braking

values.description: Car feels unstable during heavy braking zones
values.symptoms: Rear wants to swap ends, lockups, unpredictable behavior under brakes

nodes.notes: CONNECT THIS if the car feels unstable during braking

nodes.name: ‚ö†Ô∏è Low Overall Traction

values.description: General lack of mechanical grip throughout corners
values.symptoms: Sliding in all phases, tires overheating quickly, poor tire wear

nodes.notes: CONNECT THIS if you have low overall grip/traction

nodes.name: ‚ö†Ô∏è Curb Instability

values.description: Car becomes unsettled when riding curbs
values.symptoms: Bouncing off curbs, losing grip over bumps, car upset by kerbs

nodes.notes: CONNECT THIS if the car is unstable over curbs/kerbs

nodes.name: Collect Issues
nodes.notes: Collects all connected handling issues

nodes.name: Build Analysis Request
nodes.notes: Aggregates car info and all handling issues into a structured format

nodes.name: Has Issues?
nodes.notes: Checks if any issues were connected

nodes.name: Setup Advisor AI

parameters.systemPrompt:
You are an expert iRacing setup engineer and driving coach with deep knowledge of car dynamics, suspension geometry, aerodynamics, and tire behavior. You provide specific, actionable setup advice based on reported handling issues.

When giving advice:
1. Explain WHY each adjustment helps the specific issue
2. Provide specific adjustment directions (increase/decrease, soften/stiffen)
3. Prioritize adjustments by impact (most effective first)
4. Consider how changes might affect other aspects of handling
5. Include driving technique tips that complement setup changes

Format your response with clear sections:
- DIAGNOSIS: Brief analysis of the handling balance
- SETUP CHANGES: Prioritized list of recommended adjustments
- DRIVING TIPS: Technique adjustments to complement setup changes
- WARNINGS: Potential trade-offs to watch for

nodes.notes: AI analyzes handling issues and provides setup recommendations

nodes.name: No Issues Selected
nodes.notes: Provides instructions if no issue nodes are connected

nodes.name: Format Recommendations
nodes.notes: Parses and formats the AI recommendations

nodes.name: Final Output
nodes.notes: Combines successful advice or no-issues message (exclusive branches - only one will fire)

nodes.name: Setup Advice Result
nodes.notes: Final formatted output

settings.description: Connect handling issue nodes to describe your car's behavior, then get AI-powered setup recommendations. Default setup includes understeer on slow entry and oversteer on exit - modify connections to match your issues.
